allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add concurrent interpret_tables\(\) and DOCX extraction pipeline

Add interpret_tables\(\) sync function that wraps interpret_tables_async\(\)
for concurrent multi-table interpretation — eliminates sequential for
loops when consolidating denormalized tables into a single normalized
DataFrame. Uses asyncio.gather\(\) for parallel LLM calls \(parse + map\).

Update walkthrough_docx.ipynb to use interpret_tables\(\) with to_pandas\(\)
serialization and side-by-side FROM→TO visualization \(raw pipe-table vs
normalized DataFrame\). Add DOCX extractor with merged cell handling,
compound headers, user-defined classification, and test suite.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Extract format-agnostic classify_tables\(\) from DOCX-specific classify_docx_tables\(\)

Classification logic now operates on compressed pipe-table markdown tuples
\(the shared format from both DOCX and PDF paths\) instead of re-parsing
DOCX grids. This gives PDF tables classification for free via
StructuredTable.to_compressed\(\).

New module: classify.py with _keyword_matches, _compute_similarity,
_parse_pipe_header, _tokenize_header_text, and public classify_tables\(\).
classify_docx_tables\(\) is now a thin wrapper. 56 new adversarial tests
cover word boundaries, multilingual text, compound headers, propagation
edge cases, and degenerate inputs.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
